message: How anyone can say President Obama is anything but amazing blows my mind. He has worked tirelessly to improve the quality of our lives. He has led the world with class and diplomacy. He has not had any support from a Congress with a 13% approval rating. God bless him and his family.
We are no longer a nation of laws for all, it's just over.
They turn a blind eye to it because there is no epic corruption.
And this is news because why?

Sony is saying that technology progresses. Is there somehow who actually disagrees with that? Everyone crying tears into a pillow that their PS4v1 might no longer be the top dog of consoles should get a grip. Technology is obsolete before it even hits retailers. How do these sorts of stories yield so many nonsensical replies? The heat comments are garbage, betraying a fundamental misunderstanding of the entire field. GPUs get better. Indeed, one of the biggest improvements lately has been *huge* reductions in the power consumption, and thus heat, of GPUs.

FYI The Real Math (As of June, 4th, 2016) Total Number of Delegates Available = 4763 CURRENT Score Hillary Clinton = 1769 Bernie Sanders = 1501 Total Number of Delegates Required to Clinch the Nomination = 2383 Total Number of Delegates Remaining = 1493 Total Number of Delegates Who Vote on June 4th Through June 14th, 2016 = 930 No Candidate Can Clinch the Nomination Before June 14, 2016 Hillary Clinton Would Need 614 out of 930 Bernie Sanders Would Need 882 out of 930 Total Number of Delegates Who Vote on July 25th, 2016 = 719 (Democratic National Convention) The Nomination Will Be Decided on July 25th, 2016.
